Tengo que decir que me ha enganchado más que el Left4Dead, porque es más sencillo de jugar en los niveles bajos de dificultad y no dependes tanto de tus compañeros para sobrevivir (a partir del nivel difícil es indispensable). 
Gráficos correctos y variedad de mapas pero no de modos. A cambio tenemos habilidad como Médico o Francotirador por citar alguno en los que tienes habilidades pasivas y armas propias. 
Un buen juego matainfectados en el que es casi obligatorio jugar con amigos.

I could play this game all day long, that is how fun this game really is!! It has amazing ZED times that really give good shots when detroying an enemy (ex. Blow of heads) and it can be really challenging once you play Suicidal or even Hell on earth. It's rather awesome too that instead of just having the regular get a gun and shoot kind of games, you can choose out of 7 different kinds of perks that no one would even think of! I gotta say, this game is really well done, and it's funny when the zeds change depending on the holiday XD I also like the british accents that they have in this game, it's really funny XD

Keep it up, KF! :D

It was what seems like ages ago now when I bought my first true gaming PC and KF is the very first game I received on Steam, as a gift from my ol' lady. The carnival seasonal event was going on right before I purchased, and it's trailer sold me...I've had so much fun with this game. 

If I didn't have work the next day, I'd stay up late and play all night, turning clots into giblets. The best co-op FPS there was. Graphics were never as polished as AAA FPS's but it didn't need to be. The gameplay more than made up for it. Seasonal maps, skins, and level progression for each class kept the game fresh. I highly recommended this game to anyone who likes wave based FPS, you can't go wrong with Killing Floor in your collection. 

I'd eventually move on to KF2, but I'll never forget the experience I had with the OG KF.

Killing Floor failed to grab me, the many times I've tried to play it over the years.
It's not that it's a bad game, but a lacking one. The core shooting mechanic they settled on years ago just lacks any sense, for me, satisfaction or a feeling of accomplishment for even pulling it off. 

While it succeeds in the classic feeling of terror of being surrounded, it is a fear from frustration more than fun.

Killing floor is a tense action packed horror shooter with a large and friendly modding and multiplayer community large amounts of adaptability.
The fast placed and strategic gameplay leads to near endless replayability, now to the enemies creatures with swords bursting from their hands to ozing fat creatures that spit acidic bile or mutated females that shriek ear peircingly it does not lack when it comes to the enemy, something that adds to the horror aspect of the game are the specimens as they are called can appear from nowhere and from all directions.
The maps in Killing floor are well crafted and elaborate, some abilities the player has are welding the doors shut laying traps and  simply jumping off a building taking damage rather than be overwhelmed.
Over all Killing floor is a great addition to the library of an FPS lover a Survival horror lover or to any Gamer.

Qu'on se le dise, Killing Floor est un bon jeu. Cependant, ce serait se mentir que de dire qu'il ne souffre d'aucun défaut.

Déjà, graphiquement, à moins d'être resté coincé en 2007, Killing Floor est très largement dépassé : l'Unreal Engine 2, c'était bien en 2003/2004, mais malheureusement, en 2010, c'est plus vraiment ça : les modèles sont bien polygonnés, les animations sont un peu trop mécaniques et les textures un peu crade... Plutôt bof, donc. Heureusement , artistiquement, le jeu s'en sort bien, l'ambiance de fin du monde/apoclypse "zombie" est bien retranscrite et le level design est bien foutu avec des maps d'anthologie (mention spéciale aux cartes Farm ou Aperture).

Côté sonore, c'est très mitigé, là aussi. Autant les musiques sont bien sympas, autant le doublage VF est juste catastrophique. Mais vraiment, hein, j'exagère pas : ne jouez pas en Français à ce jeu. La VO passe déjà mieux, même si c'est pas transcendant (carton rouge à la vendeuse, notamment).

Pour ce qui est de la jouabilité, eh bien là encore c'est bofbof. Autant les contrôles répondent bien, et les bugs sont peu nombreux, autant l'impossibilité de sprinter plombe vraiment le gameplay. Résultat, au lieu d'avoir un jeu bien nerveux, on a un jeu assez lent où va tenir des positions plutôt que de courir partout. C'est un peu déstabilisant pour être tout à fait honnète. La présence d'un Bullet Time est, elle aussi, très déstabilisante : si d'un côté celui-ci permet de faciliter sa visée lorsqu'un allié réussi un headshot, d'un autre côté, sa présence entraine très souvent des cassures de rythme (notamment en l'absence d'ennemis ou lorsque l'on recharge son arme).

Niveau durée de vie, en revanche, y a vraiment de quoi faire : terminer toutes les maps dans tous les modes de difficulté et dans tous les modes de jeu demandera énormément de temps. Et cela, c'est sans compter les événements spéciaux qui se déroulent en été, pour Halloween et à Noël. D'ailleurs, à l'heure où sont écrites ces lignes, la communauté sur Steam est toujours très active : il n'est pas difficile de trouver et de rejoindre des serveurs publics et ceux-ci sont bien remplis. La communauté est d'ailleurs dans son immense majorité très sympa et très mature, ce qui n'est pas un mal vu que le jeu requiert de jouer très teamplay et de ne pas hésiter à partager son argent. Dernier petit point concernant les créations via le workshop : elles sont nombreuses et variées, là encore, y a de quoi faire.

En conclusion, Killing Floor est un jeu qui n'est certes pas exempt de défaut mais qui malgré tout vaut le détour, surtout lorsqu'il est joué en clan ou en team où il y a moyen de bien s'amuser. Cependant, ses graphismes totalement dépassés, sa VF complètement ratée et les quelques défauts dans son gameplay inciteront à attendre une promo pour acquérir ce jeu (parce que, bon, quand même, 20€, ça fait un poil cher).

Bom jogo, bons gráficos e muitas armas para comprar. Eu pelo menos achei melhor que L4D2.

This is a really fun game. You have different classes to choose from, you can play by yourself, or play co-op with others. Tons of weapons and different characters to choose from to differentiate yourself from others.
Весёлоя игра,командная.

What is Killing Floor, you ask? British People vs Zombies: The game. Complete with Dosh, Heavy Metal, more stereotypical Brits than a Monty Python sketch, and over 32 of some of the beefiest, most satisfying Zed-killing weapons you'll encounter in a video game. There's even 'Loadsamoney' himself, Mr Harry Einfeld, present and accounted for to wreck the Zed menace. 

This is a game where you need to play on a difficulty higher than 'beginner' to experience. The fun of this game comes from it's challenge, and while I can understand people liking their games as easy, simple fun, the real 'survival horror' elements of this game come out when you're up against tougher enemies. I personally don't find this game scary due to the undertone silliness from all the characters models and event Zeds, but I still have a lot of fun with this game.

Despite coming out back in 2009, Tripwire Interactive have been supporting this game for the last 4 years, and with each update, event and DLC pack they've added, the game's got better and better! 

So go ahead and pick up a copy of this now! Hell, get the 'bundle' copy which contains 90% of the game's DLC for only slightly more (trust me, most of it may be character models, but by god are they worth it).
If you ever wanted a video game equivalent of Shaun of the Dead, you need to play this.

This game puts you through wave after wave of undead hordes and special mutations that the Horzine company has to throw at you plus having to work together with your (sometimes disfuntional)team. It has a medium gore factor and hilarious ragdoll effects for your enjoyment, plus tons perks, weapons and maps to explore. The Zeds can be a bit buggy at times but all in all Killing Floor is a great game.
Co-Op, FPS action with funny, British voice acting. Not for Kids (Lots a' gore).
BEST GAME EVER!!! It is so much fun to play this with your friends.
